Options: [ small or large ] the trophy doesn't fit into the suitcase although the trophy is small
Options: [ rich or poor ] John gave a lot of money to Susan although John was poor
Options: [ fast or slow ] the truck overtook the bus although the truck was going slow
Options: [ hard or soft ] the ball crashed right through the board although the ball was soft
Options: [ tall or short ] John couldn't see the stage behind Susan although John is tall
Options: [ later or first ] the bag of potatoes had been placed above the bag of flour although the bag of potatoes had to be moved later
Options: [ full or empty ] the bottle was filled with water from the cup although the bottle was full
Options: [ older or younger ] Jack always takes care of Betty although Jack is younger
Options: [ minority or majority ] the sponsors were less in number than the opponents although the sponsors were in the majority
Options: [ wide or narrow ] the table will fit through the doorway although the table is wide
Options: [ full or hungry ] Bill passed the half-empty plate to Amy although Bill was hungry
Options: [ notorious or popular ] James ceded the presidency to Amy although James was popular
